Girl with Limbs Rotting Off: “Thank you for all your hard work. Please, please rest in peace now. ”

Narration: At the start of it all, back when I had no companions,

Narration: I was referred to not as a Savior, but as a witch.

Narration: When I opened my eyes in Orkney, I received knowledge from another me.

Narration: The Morgan of pan-human history.

Narration: The Fairy Princess who chose to entrust everything to me, despite knowing she herself would shatter.

Narration: I learned of Morgan's fate.

Narration: A woman who had no place of her own in pan-human history.

Narration: A woman who was vanquished by King Arthur, despite having been born as the heir to Britain.

Narration: To Morgan, Britain was everything.

Narration: If she could not have Britain, Morgan would have no worth.

Narration: And so she became worthless.

Narration: Summoned to the British Lostbelt, that “me” must surely have lamented after seeing the tragic state of the island.

Narration: But she surely must have also thought this:

Narration: “This time, in this Britain. ”

Narration: For the “me” with no place to belong, protecting this new place of hers must have been the obvious thing to do.

Narration: I was given a task from Paradise, but that task was to end Britain.

Narration: “I” loved the island of Britain, even if it happened to be a Lostbelt.

Narration: I too, felt the same way.

Narration: Thus, I chose to live as “me”.

Voices of the fairies: Accursed witch, accursed witch, accursed witch! Even though a Calamity occurred, you alone survived!

Narration: But to do that, I must first subdue the fairies.

Narration: I cleansed the Calamities time and time again, I mediated the conflicts between the clans time and time again.

Narration: Time and time again, I was branded a witch. Time and time again, my heart broke.

Narration: But that is fine. I do not love the fairies.

Narration: What I love is Britain. This country that I will belong to, that I will build.

Narration: A Britain of my own that I could never obtain in pan-human history.

Narration: I felt that there was nothing I would not do to realize that, and so I did my best.

Narration: However, looking at the means, protecting the fairies turned out to be the right answer after all.

Girl Discarded due to Overuse: “Thank you, thank you...” “Thank you for giving me water, thank you...”

Girl Discarded due to Overuse: “But, Lady Witch, please drink it yourself. After all, you've been working so hard. ”

Narration: Over the years, I've grown rather fond of the means as well.

Narration: I gained companions I could confide in. I got better at conducting myself.

Narration: And I learned how to act like the Savior I never was.

Narration: I thought that if I am to be a Savior, then the fairy who gave me a name would rejoice. Thus, I changed my name to Tonelico.

Narration: Londinium is lost. All my companions have left me.

Narration: But that is fine. This time, I shall build my ideal country, my Britain.

Narration: I have been living for this reason alone. For that reason alone, “I” had shattered.

Narration: My Britain. My Fairy Kingdom.

Narration: To tell the truth, I had been planning on making it a far harsher country. But I would feel sorry for her if I did so, and thus, chose a kinder path.

Narration: I shall allow you to laugh. I shall allow you to have fun.

Narration: I shall allow you to forge connections. I shall allow you to prosper. And I pray it lasts forevermore.

Narration: I am a traitor to the Human Order. I went against my mission from Paradise and realized my dream instead.

Narration: Though the Fairy Kingdom is isolated by the wall of the furthest end, it still exists on the same coordinates on the planet.

Narration: Visitors from pan-human history may come.

Narration: How was my country? Was it a beautiful country? Was it a dream-like country?

Narration: Nothing would make me happier than that.

Narration: My dear visitor, welcome to the Fairy Kingdom of Britain.

Narration: I pray this scenery will forever remain within your memories.

Spriggan: What!?

Morgan: Haa—aaa—

Morgan: I told you not to underestimate me...even if all that remains is my head, you are still no match for me.

C：Morgan: Aaa...haaaa...haaa...

C：Morgan: Haa...haaa...haaaa...!

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (W-w-what should we do, what do we do...!? Spriggan's rebelling, isn't he!? )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (Does that make Spriggan the King, then? No, no, Queen Morgan is still alive! )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (Even though she can't move anything other than her left hand anymore? She's not going to beat the rebels this way, you know? )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (Hold on, then what happens to us? We'll be killed by the rebels! )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (Should we help Her Majesty, then? Spriggan isn't very dependable...if we get her back to the throne, she might be able to do something? )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (No thanks, she's drenched in blood. Besides, it'd just be for show no matter who we side with. )

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: (You're right, you're right! Let's wait and see! We can just pick the winning side! )

Voice of Aurora: However...despite that kindness, there are certain truths that I cannot overlook.

Voice of Aurora: To those of you fighting at Camelot, I beg you to listen.

Voice of Aurora: To the truth about who Queen Morgan really is, and what she has been doing behind the curtains of history.

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: That's Aurora's “Voice of the Wind”! What on earth does she want to say?

Voice of Aurora: All of this was schemed by a single woman.

Voice of Aurora: The savior, Tonelico, who was said to have saved the fairies during the Fairy Calendar.

Voice of Aurora: She is no fairy of Britain. She is a fairy who came from a different world. She is our enemy.

Voice of Aurora: Her goal was to rule Britain.

Voice of Aurora: For that reason, she caused many Calamities to occur and disrupted the bonds between the clans.

Voice of Aurora: Chief amongst those acts was the destruction of Londinium.

Voice of Aurora: She killed Uther, the King of Britain, when he appeared at long last, and broke the harmony between the clans.

Voice of Aurora: For her, all other monarchs were eyesores.

Voice of Aurora: The blood and hatred that surged in this conflict caused the largest ever Great Calamity to occur.

Voice of Aurora: There are few fairies still alive now to speak of it...

Voice of Aurora: But on that day, 2,000 years ago, our Britain perished once.

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: What is Aurora saying? We perished?

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: That's not possible. Then what would that make the fairies still alive now!?

Voice of Aurora: No. Rather, it would have been better to have perished in the Great Calamity.

Voice of Aurora: Because the fairies who survived would have been able to build a peaceful Britain afterwards.

Voice of Aurora: But that did not happen. Having survived the fall of Londinium, Tonelico—

Voice of Aurora: The witch Morgan undertook a terrifying endeavor.

Voice of Aurora: Morgan used our precious World Tree for her own ends.

Voice of Aurora: She stole the magical energy stored within the World Tree and desiccated it.

Voice of Aurora: Using that magical energy, she revived us fae with what was apparently called a Chaldea-type summoning.

Voice of Aurora: The Command Spell we fairies bear is not something carved into us at Camelot.

Voice of Aurora: They are something possessed from birth. The mark of a slave, offering its accumulated time and magical energy to the witch.

Voice of Aurora: Thus, the witch started a new Britain. Along with a false era known as the Queen's Calendar.

Voice of Aurora: The reason why the land of Britain does not expand, the reason we are not permitted to make effective use of humans.

Voice of Aurora: And the reason Britain perished in the Great Calamity. It is because they were all designed as such.

Voice of Aurora: Please know this. For around 2,000 years, we fairies of Britain...

Voice of Aurora: ...were made to suffer, used by the witch for her own ends.

Voice of Aurora: The name of this witch is Morgan. The false monarch who came from Paradise to subjugate us.

Voice of Aurora: I do acknowledge her efforts in saving Britain from the Mors time and time again...however, I cannot revere her.

Voice of Aurora: O fairies of Camelot. Please ask yourselves this once again.

Voice of Aurora: Who is our true enemy? To which fairy should we entrust Britain?

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: ...isn't that awful?

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: Awful. It is awful.

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: It really is awful. What a joke of a queen. Come to think of it...

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: We don't really need her, do we?

Spriggan: Now this is no good...The fire's spreading faster than I expected.

Baobhan Sith: Ah...

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: Go~back~. Go~back~.

Morgan: Haa...haa...ha, a—

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: Hey, we're throwing stuff at her but she isn't stopping! Can't help it, let's use that soldier's sword over there to stop her!

Fairies Gathered Around the Throne: That's right, let's do that! You won't deceive us anymore, you vile witch!

C：Morgan: —You wretches—what are you—

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Shut up! You've made this world a horrible place!

Morgan: You are wrong...take me to the throne...without me—

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Even though you can't do a thing, you went and messed our world up over and over!

Morgan: Stop, stop—someone, please—

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Vile witch! Vile witch! You're slothful, even though you should've been able to build a far better world!

Morgan: Stop—take me to the throne—

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Useless! Useless! We don't need you! We don't need you! If you're useless, then we don't need you anymore!

Morgan: Take me back to my throne...! I don't want to lose Britain again...!

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Whew, she finally stopped moving. She struggled right up to the very end.

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: But how refreshing, she brought this on herself. She's been tormenting us fairies all this time.

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: By the way...

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: What's that filthy fairy lying over there?

--ARROW--

Fujimaru 1: The bells—

Round Table Army Soldier: Report, report! Report from the Knocknarean army!

Round Table Army Soldier: “I have reached the throne. The bells of triumph shall reverberate in testament. ”

Round Table Army Soldier: “Queen Morgan has been executed by the knights of Aurora before the throne. ”

Round Table Army Soldier: “The officials who served the Queen have been detained. The Knocknarean army has seized the throne.

Round Table Army Soldier: “Furthermore, for his contribution towards Morgan's execution, Spriggan shall be appointed interim chief of the six clans. ”

Artoria: —Executed. Was Morgan killed? Is she no longer alive?

Round Table Army Soldier: Yes. The corpse is said to be severely damaged beyond recognition. As such, there will be no next generation.

Round Table Army Soldier: Currently, the Queen's knights have begun surrendering all over the place.

Round Table Army Soldier: We are to gather before the throne as soon as our wounds have healed.

Round Table Army Soldier: It is unfortunate that you could not claim the throne, Lady Artoria...

Round Table Army Soldier: But the battle is over. The rebellion has triumphed!

Round Table Army Soldier: Things are going to get busy from now on in a different way.

Round Table Army Soldier: We all have to prepare for the coronation of Queen Morgan's successor, no–the new leader of Britain.

Morgan: Why?

Morgan: Why are you like this?

Morgan: Why are you always like this, Baobhan Sith!?

Narration: That person lamented, almost as though for herself, and embraced me.

Narration: But I'm already dead. I always, always die.

Morgan: I'm always too late. I always find you only after you've already ended up like this...!

Morgan: No matter how many times you're reborn, you always end up like this—

Morgan: Deceived. Manipulated. Used. Tossed aside once broken.

Morgan: Be angry if you've been deceived. Run if they are violent with you!

Morgan: Yet, why—why do you always forgive them...!?

Narration: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Lady Witch. I'm sorry I died again in the end.

Narration: The current generation of me may not remember, but thank you for always crying for my sake.

Narration: But don't worry.

Narration: I'm a worthless fairy, so this is the least I can do to be of use to everyone else.

Narration: If using me will make things easier for everyone in the village, then that surely must be a good thing.

Morgan: —That is not true.

Morgan: You and you alone—thanked me in this Britain.

Morgan: I will definitely save you. I will definitely make sure to save you.

Morgan: I will definitely find you, before the next generation of you can be picked up by those fairies.

Morgan: And this time—I will make you happy.

Narration: But I couldn't do it.

Narration: Time and time again, Mother found me. Yet each time, it always ended like this.

Narration: The village's darling, Baobhan Sith. The ever-smiling Baobhan Sith.

Narration: I always end up worked to the bone, all the while being told I'm a “good person”.

Narration: That's why Mother told me.

Narration: That's why, after I died at Darlington with my soul worn out, with no next generation to speak of, she brought me back to life and told me:

Morgan: You should live heinously. You should live cruelly. You cannot live otherwise.

Morgan: Just once. Even just once is fine. If it means you can lead a happy life—

Morgan: I will offer Britain, my dream, to you.

Narration: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Mother. That didn't work out either.

Narration: I hate fairies. Because they always bully me.

Narration: I couldn't make even a single friend. Because I was always filthy.

Narration: But—there was one, there was one fairy I could talk normally with.

Narration: How strange. Even though I hate all of Britain's fairies, I was able to talk normally with that girl alone.

Narration: What was the name of that girl again— What was the name of that city again—

Narration: What exactly happened back then—

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: An accomplice. An accomplice. She's her daughter, so she's an accomplice.

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: I mean, she really tormented us. Let's take our time with this one.

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Wow, she's filthy. Her limbs are rotting! What do we do, what should we do!?

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Let's not bother. Just chop her up and toss her out! Out behind the throne!

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: After all, she's dropped her fair share of people down there already! Bye-bye, Morgan's princess!

Fairies Gathered Around Morgan: Thanks to you, we'll be able to keep living in this castle for the rest of our lives!

Morgan's Successor: Haha...ahaha...ahahahahahahaha!
